titleInfo.title: Supplementary Material for "Tangible Data Scanning Sonification Model"

mods.abstract:
In this paper we develop a sonification model following the Model-based sonification approach that allows to scan high-dimensional data distributions by means of a physical object in the hand of the user. In the sonification model, the user is immersed in a 3D space of invisible but acoustically active objects which can be excited by the user. Tangible computing allows to literally identify the excitation object (e.g. a geometric surface) with a physical object used as controller, and thus creates a strong metaphor for understanding and relating feedback sounds in response to the userâ€™s own activity, position and orientation. We explain the technique and our current implementation in detail and give examples at hand of synthetic and real-world data sets. ---------------------- ## Interaction Examples ### Synhetic data set
+ [Sound Example: along third coordinate (mp3 | 276k)](https://pub.uni-bielefeld.de/download/2699962/2699966) ### Glass data set
+ [Sound Example: along third coordinate (mp3 | 224k)](https://pub.uni-bielefeld.de/download/2699962/2699963) ### Iris data set
+ [Sound Example: along third coordinate (mp3 | 276k)](https://pub.uni-bielefeld.de/download/2699962/2699964) + [Sound Example: slightly not along third coordinate (mp3 | 288k)](https://pub.uni-bielefeld.de/download/2699962/2699965)
